title: Topology-Aware Wavelet Mamba for Airway Structure Segmentation in Postoperative Recurrent Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma CT Scans
author: Haishan Huang (School of Software Engineering, Sun Yat-sen University), Pengchen Liang (School of Microelectronics, Shanghai University), Naier Lin (Department of Radiology, Eye & ENT Hospital, Fudan University), Luxi Wang (Department of Radiology, Eye & ENT Hospital, Fudan University), Bin Pu (Electronic and Computer Engineering, The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology), Jianguo Chen (School of Software Engineering, Sun Yat-sen University), Qing Chang (Department Shanghai Key Laboratory of Gastric Neoplasms, Shanghai Jiao Tong University), Xia Shen (Department of Anesthesiology, Eye & ENT Hospital, Fudan University), Guo Ran (Department of Anesthesiology, Eye & ENT Hospital, Fudan University)
background: The paper proposes a novel model for accurately segmenting airway structures in postoperative CT scans of nasopharyngeal carcinoma patients to assist in airway risk assessment.
contribution: This paper introduces TopoWMamba to solve the challenge of accurately segmenting critical airway-related structures in complex CT scans, achieving an average Dice score of 88.02%.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Traditional models like UNet and its variants often struggle to capture fine anatomical details in challenging scenarios such as postoperative imaging.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves upon existing methods by integrating wavelet transforms and topology-aware components, enhancing the capture of multi-scale features and anatomical continuity.

key_innovation: Combines wavelet-based feature extraction with state-space modeling and topology-aware modules to enhance segmentation performance in complex medical imaging.
real_world_impact: The proposed model enhances postoperative airway risk assessments, which may improve patient outcomes in clinical settings for nasopharyngeal carcinoma treatment.

new_terms.wavelet transform: **Wavelet transform** is a mathematical technique used to transform a signal into different frequency components, allowing for multi-scale feature analysis.
new_terms.topology-aware modules: **Topology-aware modules** are components in neural networks that consider the structural relationships and continuity of anatomical features during segmentation.
